Explanation: A use statement lets you use a type of Object in your program. In this case, you are using the DataFrame object.
A variable declaration that makes a new DataFrame. Unlike primitive variables, DataFrame variables don’t need the = sign.
Loads the CSV file from your computer onto Quorum Studio. The file should exist in a path that the system can identify such as within the project folder.
Adds a column via index into the DataFrame object
Adds a range of columns via index into the DataFrame object
Outputs the entire loaded file into the console
Calculates the mean of a selected column of a DataFrame
Calculates the median of a selected column of a DataFrame
Calculates the Standard Deviation of a selected column of a DataFrame
Calculates the Variance of a selected column of a DataFrame
Calculates the Kurtosis of a selected column of a DataFrame
